title: Give Cyberpop Zoe heterochromia too!
body:
I think Zoe's skin is great (Futaba is second-best waifu), but it's missing a little something I feel is one of Zoe's unique features, which are her different-colored eyes). It's not really noticeable in game, probably, but you do see her face in her splash, and the splash's face is your portrait all game

It probably wouldn't be that hard to implement, and I'm hoping to buy this skin whether this happens or not, but it would be pretty nice

EDIT: Good work gang

Actually Talon is my main right now and has been for a long time. I want Project Talon too! Sadly I am not on skins team. Champions team made Cyper Pop Zoe, its the first launch skin we made!
Well then, you guys did a good job! Is there any particular reason why the champions team did it, rather than the skins team?

Launch skins were always more difficult and time-consuming than most skins because they had to begin before the base champion was locked down and then required a lot of back and forth between teams as the champion was being finished. It was easy to miss things on the skin when we weren't also working on the base, then they'd pop up as problems at the very end. I worked on the launch skins for TK, Jhin, Camille and Xayah (and now Zoe) before joining Champions team and it was something I think we all wanted to address.

So we tried it out, allocated resources and time for the same team that made the champion to also tackle the launch skin. I think it went really well and I think we're going to make it a new standard practice moving forward. It makes sense really as the champ team at that point understand the champion better than anyone else and every time they make a change to the base they can also update the skin so they both turn out top notch.
Have you thought about similar practice for VGU champions who might need a new skin right after release of their VGU?

With VGUs the champions team already handle all the skin updates. It's a lot of work stacked on top of each other, but it's also really fun. I'm looking forward to working on an update to transform some of those older skins into their own cool pieces of the skins thematic puzzle. Like what even is Infiltrator Irelia?

Hey, sorry to hijack that post, but I'll rebound on the Infiltrator comment.

Say I have a TON of questions to ask about Skins, but I'm in no hurry to get answers. What would be the best way to present them to you so you can answer a couple of them when you have some idle time, and get at the pile of it progressively?

A post on the boards? A thread of tweets? Different Asks on Tumblr? Something else?

(P.S.: I'm soooo hyped for the new Skin tab since it appears there is also some Skin lore included!! :D)

I was very peripherally involved with the skins tab stuff. Earlier this year I was on a thematic dev team for skins and one of the goals I had there was to try and get more of the 'Alt Universe's organised into a manageable amount that made sense and provided more storytelling opportunities; Project + Program, who are Battlecast fighting, is Super Galaxy and Star Guardian related or not cuz anime etc.

My understanding of skins tab is that it's primarily for players to organise and view their collection, but there is a secondary opportunity to share a bit of the ideas we have internally about skins and how some fit together - just enough to spark the imagination. I think there is also a goal to further expand upon this in the future, so that lore and grouping might continue to be refined over time.

If you have skins questions keep asking, on the boards, twitter, reddit etc. Sorry I can't commit to answering a big list myself as a) I'm not on skins any more and b) that's not really how I want to spend my free time.
OK, no problem. Thanks for the answer :)
